result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

15CF212, 15CF235, 15CF287, 15CM74, 16CF23 Defendant Steven A. Arndt in court, in custody with attorney Jessica Marie Moeller.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charges and penalties, def pleads no contest to ct. 1 15CF235, ct 1 15CF287, ct 1 15CM74, court finds plea made FVKI, court accepts plea and finds def guilty, all remaining counts and cases are DRI, state heard, defense counsel heard, defendant makes statement, court heard and sentence imposed. Atty Moeller heard on def's FTA for prelim hearing; defendant in FDL county jail; discussion held; Court will authorize warrant; Court orders DA to prepare writ;  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven A. Arndt Jr.

Prior: W3173 County Aire Drive, Campbellsport, WI 53010

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

(12:46) Defendant Steven A. Arndt in custody via video with attorney Jessica Marie Moeller (will appoint).  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State requests $5,000 Cash bail; Atty. Moeller response; Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim 2/11/16 at 1:30pm in Br. 2; Court sets $1,000.00 CASH Bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
